判.definition: (bound form) to differentiate; to distinguish; (bound form) clearly (different); to judge; to decide; to grade; (of a judge) to sentence

判別式.definition: (math.) discriminant (e.g. b²-4ac in the formula for the roots of a quadratic equation)

判官.definition: magistrate (during Tang and Song dynasties); mythological underworld judge

判定.definition: to judge; to decide; judgment; determination

判決.definition: judgment (by a court of law); to pass judgment on; to sentence

判若兩人.definition: to be a different person; not to be one's usual self

判若雲泥.definition: as different as heaven and earth (idiom); worlds apart

判袂.definition: (of two people) to separate; to part

判讀.definition: to interpret (a visual document, a medical exam, an historical event etc); to analyze data (from a chip, a black box etc)
